alert.note: Alert for Green; Rock (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 5:20PM CDT until July 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: .Training thunderstorms are causing locally heavy rain. Minor flooding is possible. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Green and Rock. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Evansville, Orfordville, Albany, Footville, Magnolia, Hanover and Leyden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
